channel.title: NER concerts
channel.description:
National Educational Radio presents a series of recorded concerts.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: 1967 Mozart Festival, program three, part one
item.description: This program, the first of four parts, presents portions of the 1967 Mozart Festival at Wurzberg.
item.dc:creator: Deutsche Welle
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: University of Illinois concert, part two
item.description: This program, the second of four parts, presents the University of Illinois Symphony Orchestra, Concert Choir, and combined choral ensembles in performance honoring the centennial of the University of Illinois. The concert was recorded at Assembly Hall.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: 1967 Mozart Festival, program two, part two
item.description: This program, the second of three parts, presents portions of a performance by the Bavarian State Radio Orchestra from the 1967 Mozart Festival at Wurzberg, Germany.
item.dc:creator: Deutsche Welle
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Riverside Church concert, part two
item.description: This program, the second of four parts, presents an organ recital in celebration of the completion of organs at Riverside Church in New York City. It was recorded May 3, 1967.
item.dc:creator: Riverside Church (New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: University of Illinois concert, part one
item.description: This program, the first of four parts, presents the University of Illinois Symphony Orchestra, Concert Choir, and combined choral ensembles in performance honoring the centennial of the University of Illinois. The concert was recorded at Assembly Hall.
item.dc:creator: University of Illinois
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: 1967 Mozart Festival, program one, part three
item.description: This program, the third of three parts, presents portions of the 1967 Mozart Festival at Wurzberg.
item.dc:creator: Deutsche Welle
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Contemporary Chamber Players play Boulez and more, part one
item.description: This program, the first of three parts, presents a performance by the Contemporary Chamber Players. It was recorded at the University of Chicago, where the group is based. The group performs works by Pierre Boulez and others.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Contemporary Chamber Players, part one
item.description: This program, the first of three parts, presents a performance by the Contemporary Chamber Players. It was recorded at the University of Chicago, where the group is based.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.description: This program, the second of three parts, presents a performance by the Contemporary Chamber Players. It was recorded at the University of Chicago, where the group is based.

item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Contemporary Chamber Players play Boone and more, part three
item.description: This program, the third of four parts, presents a performance by the Contemporary Chamber Players. It was recorded at the University of Chicago, where the group is based. The group performs works by Charles Boone and others.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: 1967 Mozart Festival, program one, part two
item.description: This program, the second of three parts, presents portions of the 1967 Mozart Festival at Wurzberg.

item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Monteverdi's 400th anniversary, part three
item.description: This program, the third of three parts, presents a concert by the Ambrosian Consort in celebration of the 400th anniversary of the birth of Claudio Monteverdi. It was recorded at Rutgers University in New Brunswick, New Jersey.
item.dc:creator: WRVR (Radio station : New York, N.Y.)
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts
